name: desiccate
content:
desiccate verb [T or I]
(DRY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to remove the moisture from something so it becomes completely dry; to lose all moisture and become completely dry: Intensive farming has desiccated the land. Some plants wither quickly and lose their power of recovery if allowed to desiccate.

desiccate verb [T or I]
(DAMAGE)
to become damaged or destroyed by losing an important quality; to damage or destroy something in this way: The global economy is desiccating by the day. He was politically and emotionally desiccated by the scandal.
